get.summary: Get a list of payments created for the user. SEPA access token will return no payments while used for the domestic endpoint and vice versa.

parameters.name: Signature
parameters.description:
A signature of request by the TPP on application level. The process of signing a request is described in 'Signing HTTP Messages' RFC draft version 10 (https://tools.ietf.org/html/draft-cavage-http-signatures-10). The request signature needs to be sent in the 'Signature' HTTP header as described in the RFC. Additional requirements from Nordea
 - The only allowed algorithm is RSA-SHA256
- The key size for the used RSA key pair has to be at least 2048 bit
- The keyId is the clientId of your application originating from the Nordea Developer Portal
- We require the following headers to be used in the signature
* GET request: (request-target) X-Nordea-Originating-Host X-Nordea-Originating-Date
* POST, PUT and PATCH request: (request-target) X-Nordea-Originating-Host X-Nordea-Originating-Date content-type digest .
* The request-target is a combination of the HTTP action verb and the request URI path

parameters.name: X-IBM-Client-Id
parameters.description: Id of the Client

parameters.name: X-IBM-Client-Secret
parameters.description: Secret password generated for the Client

parameters.name: X-Nordea-Originating-Date
parameters.description: HTTP header element for date and time represented as RFC 7231 Full Dates. example date: **Wed, 24 Apr 2019 14:00:37 EEST**, It allows to set it under JavaScript in browser while standard 'Date' is forbidden

parameters.name: X-Nordea-Originating-Host
parameters.description: HTTP header element for specification of the domain name of the server. It is similar to standard HTTP 'Host' header but it won't be overridden by proxies. It also allows to set it under JavaScript in browser while standard 'Host' is forbidden

parameters.name: X-Nordea-Originating-User-Agent
parameters.description: End user (i.e. PSU) agent information, to be provided if TPP is in session with the PSU

parameters.name: X-Nordea-Originating-User-Ip
parameters.description: End user (i.e. PSU) IP address, to be provided if TPP is in session with the PSU

401.description:
Unauthorized with failure code:
* error.apikey.missing = Missing API key. This operation requires API key, but it was missing.
* error.token = Unspecified error with supplied token.
* error.token.invalid = Missing access token or token did not authorized requested operation. This operation requires valid access token, but it was missing.
* error.token.expired = Access token has expired.

403.description:
Forbidden with failure code:
* error.resource.denied = Requested resource is not authorized by access token.

parameters.name: Digest
parameters.description: The Digest Header header as defined in [RFC3230] contains a Hash of the message body. The only hash algorithms that may be used to calculate the Digest within the context of this specification are SHA-256 and SHA-512 as defined in [RFC5843]

parameters.name: createPaymentRequestV4
parameters.description: Request to create a new payment

401.description:
Unauthorized with failure code:
* error.apikey.missing = Missing API key. This operation requires API key, but it was missing.
* error.token = Unspecified error with supplied token.

403.description:
Forbidden with failure code:
* error.resource.denied = Requested resource is not authorized by access token.

amount.description: Monetary amount of the payment. Max (digits+decimals): FI SEPA: (9+2); SE:(11+2); DK:(7+2); NO:(7+2)

currency.description: Currency code according to ISO 4217. Possible values: FI SEPA:EUR; SE:SEK; DK:DKK; NO:NOK

external_id.description: Unique identification as assigned by a partner to identify the payment.

urgency.description:
Urgency of the payment.
NB: This field is only supported for DK Domestic payments.

failures.description: More details on the occurred error

path.description: JSON path of the failing element if applicable

type.description: Type of the validation error, e.g. NotNull

_type.description: Example 'domestic_transaction' only for DK domestic payments

country_code.description: Country code according to ISO Alpha-2

Fee.title: Fee
Fee.description: An amount the bank will charge for executing the payment

href.description: Relative path to the linked resource

rel.description: Describes the nature of the link, e.g. 'details' for a link to the detailed information of a listed resource.

continuation_key.description: Resource listing may return a continuationKey if there's more results available. Request may be retried with the continuationKey, but otherwise same parameters, in order to get more results.

_id.description: Unique payment identifier assigned for new payment

amount.description: Monetary amount of the payment. Max (digits+decimals): FI SEPA: (9+2); SE:(11+2); DK:(7+2); NO:(7+2)

currency.description: Currency code according to ISO 4217. Possible values: FI SEPA:EUR; SE:SEK; DK:DKK; NO:NOK

entry_date_time.description: Timestamp of payment creation. ISO 8601 format yyyy-mm-ddThh:mm:ss.fffZ

external_id.description: Unique identification as assigned by a partner to identify the payment.

fee.description: An amount the bank will charge for executing the payment

timestamp.description: Timestamp of payment creation. ISO 8601 format yyyy-mm-ddThh:mm:ss.fffZ

urgency.description:
Urgency of the payment.
NB: This field is only supported for DK Domestic payments.

message.description: Message for the creditor to appear on their transaction. Max length: FI SEPA:140; SE:12 (PGNR/BGNR:150); DK: 40; NO: 140

name.description: Name of the creditor. Max length: FI SEPA: 70; SE: 35; DK: Not use; NO: 30

reference.description: Reference for the creditor to appear on their transaction

message.description:
Own message to be on the debitor's transaction. Max length 20.
NB: This field is not supported for SEPA payments and will be ignored.

_type.description: Type of the reference number, e.g. RF

message_identification.description: Original request id for correlation purposes
